ticket.title: RFC-0028 REQ-0002 identity/freshness/revocation closure and temporal arbitration

tickets.reason: Identity/freshness checks consume lifecycle intent/receipt typing from REQ-0001 baseline.

in_scope: Enforce Tier2+ fail-closed identity membership, freshness, and revocation dominance checks at revalidate/consume.
Bind temporal evaluation to shared predicates TP-EIO29-001 and TP-EIO29-008 with signed arbitration receipts.
Implement explicit behavior for agreed allow/deny and transient/persistent disagreement outcomes.
Emit structured deny defects for stale/unknown/unverifiable temporal or identity state.

steps: Add evaluator tuple validation for temporal predicate checks.
Wire revocation-frontier freshness and ambiguity checks into admission path.
Implement S3 freeze trigger on transient disagreement and deny on persistent disagreement.
Add adversarial tests for stale windows, revoked identities, and disagreement timeout.

criteria: Tier2+ admissions deny on stale or ambiguous identity/freshness state.
Temporal arbitration outcomes map to required fail-closed behaviors with signed receipts.
No wall-time-only freshness path can authorize promotion-critical effects.

notes.security: Unknown temporal authority state is non-admissible for promotion-critical decisions.
notes.verification: Include tests for agreement, transient disagreement, persistent disagreement, and deadline miss.
notes.general: This ticket establishes temporal/identity closure needed by compromise and projection tickets.
